feed.title: Hi. I'm Matt.
feed.subtitle: A possibly useful blog. Find possibly useful infosec items here, among other random things.

entry.title: Vulnhub - Sunset Dawn3 walkthrough
entry.summary:
Introduction Vulnhub dawn2 is listed on Vulnhub’s site as beginner/intermediate. This shares a lot of similarities with Sunset Dawn2, only this is VM is a bit easier to pop. Skills you’ll need are as follows:
basic reconnaissance port mapping basic binary analysis and disassembly custom Metasploit module development
Find the host on the network I use a lab for running these VMs. The ...

entry.title: Alpine Linux - Using nftables
entry.summary:
Setting up Install Alpine Linux. Having a port listening (ssh or http for example) will help in testing out your firewall rules. Next, install nftables with the following command. $ apk add nftables
The Alpine installer will pull in any necessary dependencies.
Configuration We’ll be working with the file /etc/firewall.nft. By default this file is empty. Let’s populate it. This is a basic nf...

entry.title: Vulnhub - Sunset Dawn2 walkthrough
entry.summary:
Introduction The vulnhub discription says this VM is intermediate difficulty. Some of the skills you’ll be required to use are as follows:
basic reconnaissance port mapping unlisted file and directory discovery basic disassembly basic binary analysis
And of course, creative thinking is very helpful.
Finding the host on the network. This part is easy. I have a small private lab I ...

entry.title: Vulnhub walkthroughs
entry.summary:
On the issue of walkthroughs When I first discovered intentionally vulnerable virtual machines, I got so sucked into (lost even) in the world of ethical hacking. I absolutely loved thrill of quickly and effectively increasing my knowledge of digital attacks against computer systems.
But something always bothered me. Quite often there were virtual machines that I was completely lost on. I’d ask...
